Contentious material about living persons that is unsourced or poorly sourced **must be removed immediately** from the article and its talk page, especially if potentially libelous. *Find sources:* "Evelyn Tan" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(March 2020)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Evelyn Tan Yuit Yin** (born 7 October 1974) is a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singaporean) actress, host, educator and former singer. Tan was ranked by local media as the 'Fifth Ah Jie' for being the fifth most prominent actress in Singapore's Chinese-language entertainment industry of that time after [Zoe Tay](/wiki/Zoe_Tay), [Fann Wong](/wiki/Fann_Wong), [Ann Kok](/wiki/Ann_Kok) and [Phyllis Quek](/wiki/Phyllis_Quek). She was prominently a full-time [Mediacorp](/wiki/Mediacorp) artiste from 1997 to 2005. ## Early life Tan studied at [Chung Cheng High School (Main)](/wiki/Chung_Cheng_High_School_(Main)) and [Temasek Junior College](/wiki/Temasek_Junior_College) and graduated from the [National University of Singapore](/wiki/National_University_of_Singapore) with a degree in mathematics. ## Career Tan joined [Star Search Singapore](/wiki/Star_Search_Singapore) in 1997 after university and was offered a contract by [Television Corporation of Singapore](/wiki/Television_Corporation_of_Singapore) (TCS) after making the top 20. The following year, she won the Most Popular Newcomer poll at the [Star Awards 1998](/wiki/Star_Awards_1998). In 1998, Tan was signed by Hype Records, the third TCS artiste signed up by the company after [Fann Wong](/wiki/Fann_Wong) and [Zoe Tay](/wiki/Zoe_Tay). In 1999, Tan and Dreamz FM, a local band, performed the song "Together" (心连心), the National Day theme song, at the 1999 [Singapore National Day Parade](/wiki/Singapore_National_Day_Parade). In September 2000, Tan joined the newly formed [SPH MediaWorks](/wiki/SPH_MediaWorks) and diversified into hosting, presenting and newsreading. When it merged with [MediaCorp](/wiki/MediaCorp) in 2005, she was transferred to MediaWorks' [parent company](/wiki/Singapore_Press_Holdings) but subsequently resigned for family reasons. ## Personal life Tan met fellow artiste [Darren Lim](/wiki/Darren_Lim) in 1998, during the TV remake of [Beauty World](/wiki/Beauty_World_(musical)) for the President's Star Charity Show, with Tan as the protagonist and Lim as her love interest. Tan and Lim subsequently dated and married on 27 March 2004.
